It looks like there are some real test failures.
I'm closing this for now since the Flink Client API right now makes it too hard to get async job submission and querying of job state. Flink 1.4 will hopefully remedy this.

Coverage remained the same at 70.68% when pulling **8f1df14f9b2adb012bfbe16f565bd62cee8eb802 on aljoscha:jira-2571-fix-flink-watermark-issues** into **91c7d3d1f7d72e84e773c1adbffed063aefdff3b on apache:master**.

closed, 
Thank you @takidau
seems the code is merged successfully right? I'll take care of it in a following PR in case any error.
Code is merged successfully now, correct. I fixed things and revised the history accordingly.

LGTM. Merged. Please feel free to close. Thank you!

Note that I made a few changes in the merge:
- Didn't need operands.clear() calls everywhere anymore
- Split out one remaining method that had three test cases in it into three independent test methods
- Fixed annotation placement to be on the line preceding, as is our typical style.
Merged. Didn't explode the test method, since there are already a number of other similar test methods in that file. We can clean those up later. Feel free to close, thanks!
Awesome, thanks!

Given the bug above, it seems like we can either proceed with this as is, or drop this for now and wait for the more complete fixes (moving the "construction failed" bit to the main Pipeline), etc. Thoughts on path forward?

Thanks, PTAL. Re: gating for the "Save state for resuming" block. Yes, it's intended that it gates on result.getResidualRestriction() - whether or not we need to resume depends on whether or not there is a checkpoint to resume from; there can be a checkpoint regardless of what the ProcessElement call returned (stop() or resume()). If it returned resume(), that only means that the checkpoint will (usually; modulo races) be taken after the call completes.

Coverage decreased (-0.05%) to 70.633% when pulling **8483d42b80fb96070744169e129106e06bc8899a on reuvenlax:fix_dynamic_destination_sharding** into **91c7d3d1f7d72e84e773c1adbffed063aefdff3b on apache:master**.
retest this please
Is this PR blocked on something right now?

Looks like there are build issues, can you please fix?

Also, regarding the change in `SimpleQueryTransform.expand`, my question was whether `toBuilder().build()` could be used in place of manually constructing a copy of this. It's both shorter, and more maintainable since the AutoValue generator will keep track of making sure new fields are also copied as the AutoValue object evolves over time.

Not really, we are just waiting for @davorbonaci to give his LGTM for the changes he requested and then it will be ready to go. I really want to see this merged. Btw Davor can you take a final look so we merge this.

Note: After the LGTM we will squash the extra commits of the review + pump the version to 2.2.0-SNAPSHOT.

rebased to fix the compile issue.

`toBuilder().build()` doesn't work here, as `SimpleQueryTransform.expand` returns `QueryTransform`, they've different interfaces.

Regarding to the interface of UDF, your concern is reasonable, created BEAM-2609 for further discussion.

This is loosely related to my previous change — this ensures that non-retryable errors can be returned quickly without getting tied up in the retry & client-side backoff behaviour. I updated the read connector at the same time.
